title: A look at how we're building more sustainable hardware - The Keyword | Google Product and Technology News
summary: The company is increasing the use of recycled materials in its products, achieving 30% recycled content in new products and 48% in plastic components. It has partnered with iFixit to provide genuine spare parts for repairs, enhancing repair options for customers. Additionally, the company is working towards eliminating plastic from its product packaging by 2025, having already reduced packaging plastic by 97% in 2022.
green_innovation: TRUE; the article describes innovations that significantly reduce environmental impacts by increasing the use of recycled materials, promoting repairability, and reducing packaging plastic.
business_innovation: TRUE; the article describes new processes and partnerships that improve product offerings and customer services, such as the introduction of genuine spare parts and sustainable packaging.
green_product: TRUE; the products mentioned in the article, such as the Pixel phones, utilize recycled materials and are designed to have a lower environmental impact, meeting the definition of green products.
green_process: TRUE; the processes described, including using recycled materials in manufacturing and the plan to eliminate plastic packaging, are aimed at minimizing environmental impacts, aligning with the definition of a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334210 - Telephone Apparatus Manufacturing; 335999 - All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing; 326199 - All Other Plastics Product Manufacturing; 541510 - Computer Systems Design and Related Services
greenwashing: FALSE; the article provides clear and substantiated actions towards environmental improvement without exaggeration or misleading claims.

title: Why is recycling so important? The dirty truth behind our trash - ZME Science
summary: The article discusses the importance and benefits of recycling, emphasizing its role in reducing waste, conserving natural resources, and decreasing energy consumption. It highlights how recycling can mitigate environmental damage and create economic opportunities, as well as its contribution to sustainability. With examples like the energy savings from recycled materials, the article illustrates recycling as a vital component in addressing the challenges of a consumer-driven society.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article presents recycling as a green innovation because it actively contributes to environmental sustainability by reducing waste, conserving resources, and minimizing energy consumption.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article does not identify a new or improved product or business process introduced to the market; rather, it discusses the process of recycling itself.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not focus on a specific good or service that meets the definition of a green product; it talks about the recycling process in general.
green_process: TRUE. Recycling is described as a green process because it involves methods that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability by reducing waste and conserving resources.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 56292 (Materials Recovery Facilities), 562111 (Solid Waste Collection), 423930 (Recyclable Material Merchant Wholesalers), 332431 (Metal Can Manufacturing)
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not appear to be an example of greenwashing as it provides factual information regarding the benefits of recycling without making misleading claims about environmental benefits.

title: BRIDGESTONE DEVELOPS TIRE USING 75% RECYCLED AND RENEWABLE MATERIALS INCLUDING RECYCLED ... - PR Newswire
summary: Bridgestone Americas has produced demonstration tires made with 75% recycled and renewable materials, including synthetic rubber from recycled plastics and natural rubber harvested from desert shrubs in Arizona. The company aims to reach 100% sustainable materials in its products by 2050 and is collaborating with automakers for testing and market development. Bridgestone emphasizes a long-term commitment to sustainability through its innovations and the use of bio-based materials. The initiative aligns with their Bridgestone E8 Commitment towards a sustainable society.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is green innovation as it involves the development of tires made with a high percentage of recycled and renewable materials, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE: This is a business innovation because Bridgestone has introduced a new product that significantly differs from their previous offerings, utilizing advanced sustainable materials.
green_product: TRUE: The tires produced with 75% recycled and renewable materials qualify as a green product due to their design and production aimed at reducing environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE: The use of innovative manufacturing techniques that integrate renewable resources and minimize waste makes this a green process.
product_or_process: demonstration tires made with 75% recycled and renewable materials
likely_naics_codes: [{'code': '326211', 'category': 'Tire manufacturing (except retreading)'}, {'code': '325211', 'category': 'Plastics material and resin manufacturing'}, {'code': '311119', 'category': 'Other animal food manufacturing'}, {'code': '321992', 'category': 'Wood container and pallet manufacturing'}]
greenwashing: FALSE: There is no indication of greenwashing in this article as Bridgestone provides substantial information about the sustainable materials and processes used, along with clear goals and commitments towards sustainability.

title: Setting Buy Clean Standards to Green US Steel - Rocky Mountain Institute
summary: The article discusses the Buy Clean Standards initiative aimed at lowering emissions in US steel production while promoting domestic manufacturing. It emphasizes the importance of designing effective standards to facilitate near-term emissions reductions and long-term decarbonization while preventing potential harm to the domestic steel industry. The article also highlights the necessity of transparency around recycled content in environmental product declarations to support fair emissions target-setting. It concludes by asserting that federal investment and a strategy towards zero-emissions steel production are crucial for the industry's transformation.
green_innovation: TRUE: The Buy Clean Standards initiative seeks to reduce the environmental impact of steel manufacturing through decarbonization policies and promoting sustainable practices in the industry.
business_innovation: TRUE: The article discusses new or improved processes in steel manufacturing and procurement aimed at significantly altering the environmental performance of steel production, qualifying as a business innovation.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not specifically identify a good or service that qualifies as a green product; it rather discusses standards and processes.
green_process: TRUE: The processes discussed within the context of Buy Clean Standards aim at minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability in steel manufacturing, thus qualifying as a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 331110 - Iron and Steel Mills, 332996 - Fabricated Pipe and Pipe Fitting Manufacturing, 423510 - Metal Service Centers and Other Metal Merchant Wholesalers, 541620 - Environmental Consulting Services
greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not appear to be an example of greenwashing, as it discusses legitimate efforts by the government and stakeholders to establish standards that promote environmental sustainability rather than making misleading claims.
